page.title: 09 Housing in Wootton.
page.content:
The old stone houses are mainly at the centre of the village and a few are still thatched. There is quite a lot of what was originally council housing on the north and west sides of the village although some of it has now been sold to and improved by the tenants.
The majority of homes are owner occupied and the village has been added to over the last thirty years by the building of small estates and individual houses. In the small development at the southern edge of the village, recently built, the houses cost 55 000 pounds.
Most of the houses have gardens and the bungalows have generally had rooms put in their roofs.
